Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2013 06:12PM dmac60 wrote: Hi hotpinkmess...I think everyone here knows all these feelings well.  I too recently was told I have BC.  They told me over the phone...probably not a good idea.  I was alone and it was probably one of the most difficult moments in my life.  The waiting on everything is excruciating (I was diagnosed in January)  but I finally got a plan of action yesterday and today I do feel better.  I have infiltrating ductal carcinoma Stage I, Grade 3...now I still am not sure exactly what all this means, but now know I am having surgery soon.  Just knowing something has helped me.  So hang in there.  I just started on this and it is helpful for me to hear everyone's story and journey through this thing.  I never thought I would hear those words "You have cancer"  Takes your breath away.  I'm so sorry you have to go through this with two small children.  I can't even imagine.  It is hard enough with three grown children.
Posts.Title: New and Nervous, trying not to freak out. HotPinkMess FilterLady
